definition: A carefully arranged bunch of flowers, often given as a gift.
examples: She received a bouquet of roses on her birthday.
The bride held a white bouquet.

extra.memory_tip: Bouquet = bunch of blossoms tied together.

definition: A deep valley with very steep sides, usually formed by river erosion.
examples: They kayaked through a narrow canyon.
The canyon walls glowed red at sunset.

extra.memory_tip: Canyon = giant rocky corridor cut by water.

definition: Light, gentle rain falling in fine drops; to rain lightly.
examples: A fine drizzle covered the streets. (noun)
It began to drizzle just after lunch. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Drizzle = rain’s whisper, not its shout.

definition: A hanging bed made of canvas or rope netting, suspended at each end.
examples: She read a book in a garden hammock.
The hammock swayed gently in the breeze.

extra.memory_tip: Hammock = relaxing bed that hangs between two trees.

definition: A large, powerful wild cat with a yellow coat and black spots, native to the Americas.
examples: A jaguar stalked silently through the rainforest.
The jaguar is an excellent swimmer.

definition: To rest on one or both knees.
examples: Gardening required her to kneel on the grass.
They knelt in respect.

extra.memory_tip: Kneel = bend legs until knees touch the ground.

definition: A warm bedcover made of two layers of fabric with padding stitched between; to stitch layers together in decorative patterns.
examples: The colourful quilt brightened the room. (noun)
They quilted squares of fabric into a blanket. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Quilt = cosy sandwich of fabric and fluff.

definition: A puzzling question or statement to be solved; to make many holes in something or to pose riddles.
examples: Can you solve this ancient riddle? (noun)
Woodpeckers riddled the tree with holes. (verb)

definition: An underground passage through which vehicles, people or water can pass; to dig such a passage.
examples: Trains raced through the mountain tunnel. (noun)
Moles tunnel under the garden. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Tunnel = secret hollow way through earth.

definition: A line or course with sharp turns in alternating directions; to move in such a pattern; having a back-and-forth pattern.
examples: The path formed a zigzag up the hill. (noun)
Lightning zigzagged across the sky. (verb)
She drew a zigzag pattern. (adjective)
